entry.summary: Classic Cultural Tour: Mandalay, Bagan, Inle Lake, Yangon Classic Myanmar Tour (7…
entry.content:
Classic Cultural Tour: Mandalay, Bagan, Inle Lake, Yangon

Classic Myanmar Tour (7 Days/8 Nights) The classic tour of Myanmar takes in the unmissable highlights of the country, including the ancient temples of Bagan, the serenity of Inle Lake, the historical city of Mandalay, the last kingdom of Myanmar, and Yangon, home to the spectacular Shwedagon Pagoda.

  • Trip Type
    Sightseeing
  • Activities
    No Activities
  • Group Size
    No Size Limit
  • Reviews
    0 reviews
  • Trip Duration
    7 Day(s) 8 Night(s)

 

Classic Myanmar Tour (7 Days/8 Nights)

The classic tour of Myanmar takes in the unmissable highlights of the country, including the ancient temples of Bagan, the serenity of Inle Lake, the historical city of Mandalay, the last kingdom of Myanmar, and Yangon, home to the spectacular Shwedagon Pagoda.

 

Mandalay–Bagan-Inle Lake-Yangon

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent on on your time available and budget.

Day 1

Visit the three Ancient Cities of Sagaing, Amarapura and Ava (Innwa) surrounding Mandalay, exploring its history, ending the day with sunset at the famous U Bein bridge (the oldest teak bridge in the world).

 

Day 2

Take the boat along the Irrawaddy to the magnificent ruin of Mingun, the towering 18th century temple overlooking the river, the nearby 90-ton bell from that era and the stunning and brilliantly white Myatheindan Pagoda.
Back to Mandalay, the tour will take you to the “Kuthodaw Pagoda”, fondly known as the world’s largest book, as well as the Golden Palace Monastery. The day will end at Mandalay Hill for sunset and the stunning view over the city.

 

Day 3

It’s an early start to catch the boat down the Irrawaddy River to Bagan. You will be able to take in the sights and sound of river life, arriving in the late afternoon just as the sun is setting over the Bagan temples

 

As with all our trips they can be tailored to suit your needs and itinery, but would normally include all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees

 

As with all our trips they can be tailored to suit your needs and itinery, but would normally not include meals.

Insurance not included

entry.title: 3 Ancient Cities Tour
entry.summary: Three Ancient Cities Tour We are organizing daily tours and One of…
entry.content:
Three Ancient Cities Tour 

We are organizing daily tours and One of them is popular Three Ancient Cities in One Day Culture Tour in Mandalay.

On this trip we’re going to ancient, Super ancient - Amarapura, Sagaing, and Inwa—three former capitals that you’ll get to see in one jam-packed day of pagodas, ruins and markets. Think of it as a crash course in Myanmar history and culture! 


  • Amarapura: The interesting place which become the center of Buddhism reforms and learning. You will see a lot of famous sacred shrines, pagoda, monasteries, traditional workshops there.
  • Mahar Myat Muni Pagoda
  • Mahar Gandar Yone Monastery
  • Silk Waving 

  • Sagaing: One of the Myanmar’s ancient capitals, famous for its many hundreds of white, silver and gold pagodas and monasteries and its hilly landscape. 
  • Sagaing Hill
  • Sone Oo Pone Nya Shin Pagoda
  • 30 Cave Pagoda
  • Lunch break in Sagaing
  • Inwa (Ava): The capital of Myanmar kingdom for more than six hundred years. You will see the pagodas which are similar with Bagan and one of the pagoda “Yandanar Simi Pagoda is famous for “Pagoda Lost in the Garden”. Inwa is named after like” Mini-Bagan or Little Bagan”

  • Maha Aungmye Bonzan Monastery (Mal Nu  Monastery) 
  •  Bargayar Monastery (Teak-constructed Monastery)
  • Yadanar Semi Pagoda

  • U Being Bridge: The best place to enjoy the sunset in Mandalay! 

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes, dependent on on your time available and budget.

normally include all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees.


For further information and booking tour: Please contact to info@unlockmyanmar.com

entry.title: Treking Tour in Hsipaw
entry.summary: Tour – Hsipaw Hsipaw is a loving town which is in the…
entry.content:
Tour – Hsipaw

Hsipaw is a loving town which is in the northern part of Shan state.

 If you are looking for trekking experience in Myanmar – Hispaw is one of the best treks recommend to do!

Our experienced local English guide is ready to accompany with you in your adventure. 

During the trek, you will walk through the farmland, hills and jungle passing through bamboo forests and will get a great experience staying with the local family in the rural village like a local person. Food and accommodation are organized in villagers' houses. 

 A good chance to learn about the simple lifestyle of local people, clean air and fresh organic food from the farm and trees- Shan food is so good & delicious.

We can offer you:

Half Day Tour/ Full Day Tour 

  • Nam Tuk Gyi waterfall, Shan Villages & Par Pheik Hot Springs
  •  Little Bagan, Shan Village along the river (Boat Tour) 

You can go for a few hours hike or combine hiking with a boat on the river


Overnigh Treks

  • 1 Night 2 Days Trek
  • 2 Nights 3 Days Trek
  • 3 Nights 4 Days Trek

The mountains surrounding Hsipaw are home to the Palaung people, whom the legend says descend from dragons. During the overnight treks in Hsipaw you can observe the tea cultivation and their traditional way of life.

The exact trip will be tailored to your wishes and interest, dependent on your time available and budget.

Includes all transfers, transportation, accommodation, entrance and guide fees.

entry.title: Ngapali Beach
entry.summary: The best white sand beach in Myanmar, Ngapali Beach is situated in…
entry.content:
The best white sand beach in Myanmar, Ngapali Beach is situated in Rakhine state and famous
for its palm trees and clear waters of the Bay of Bengal. Ngapali Beach is one of the loveliest places in Myanmar; it is also one of the most un-spoilt beaches in the world. Not so far from the hotels, there are the fisherman villages. Seeing them fishing is just authentic. As many of us now live in crowded cities with the stress and strain of over-population, we need periods of relaxation away from urban areas, and go back closer to nature. Ngapali is accessible by flight which takes about 1 hour from Yangon, by car about 14 hours drive along the Rakhine Yoma mountain range.

entry.title: Mawlamyine
entry.summary: It was the first capital of British Burma, the setting of George…
entry.content: It was the first capital of British Burma, the setting of George Orwell’s famous 1936 memoir Shooting an Elephant. Still today, it is the important seaport and trading center in the south-eastern part of Myanmar. The first Baptist church in Myanmar and other colonial buildings, Bilu Island, world biggest reclining Buddha on the Kyauktalon Mountain, Kawgoon and Payon Caves are the main attractions. For those who want to try a bit of meditation at a peaceful place, or experience what it is like to be a monk, visit  the famous Pa-Auk forest monastery. Learn how to meditate from a professional mentor and experience tranquility.

entry.title: Hsipaw
entry.summary: Hsipaw is situated northern part of Shan state. We could call it…
entry.content: Hsipaw is situated northern part of Shan state. We could call it as a Shan royal city in the past. It is historically rich and the book called “Twilight over Burma” is a great book describing the tragic events. The town is also famous with its nature too. Some tourists even prefer the trekking here than in Kalaw or anywhere in northern Thailand. Having the train ride to Hsipaw is also something special, you will pass by the famous Goke Hteik Viaduct.

entry.title: Kalaw
entry.summary: One of the few great trek destinations in Myanmar, Kalaw is an…
entry.content: One of the few great trek destinations in Myanmar, Kalaw is an easy place to get the trekking experience and kick back for a few days to relax. The weather is pleasant and cold and the town is also notable for its significant population of Nepali Gurkhas and Indians, whose ancestors came here to build the roads and railway during the colonial era. You can reach to Inle – Naung Shwe by train or car or trekking enjoying the scenery of Kalaw.

entry.title: Kawthaung
entry.summary: When you hear the name of this country, Myanmar, you might be…
entry.content: When you hear the name of this country, Myanmar, you might be picturing temples and monasteries but, in fact, it’s much more than that. The country is rich with the gifts from the mother nature. Kawthaung, called Victoria point to the British, is southernmost part of the country and over 800 gorgeous islands are near there. The city is packed with attractions and adventure. Go there before a lot of people notice it. That is the place you should visit among the beautiful Myanmar destinations  if you love adventure, water activities like snorkeling, diving, and visiting to the local fishermen houses at remote islands. Well, if you are honeymooners, surely nowhere can make you feel special than this place.

entry.title: Golden Rock
entry.summary: Kyaikhtiyoe Pagoda, also known as Golden Rock, is one of the main…
entry.content: Kyaikhtiyoe Pagoda, also known as Golden Rock, is one of the main pilgrimage sites for local people, you don’t want to miss that place as it is one of the top ten destinations in Myanmar. Only 4 hours drive from Yangon, the pagoda is situated on the mountain cliff, only 18 ft. height. It is strongly believed as a wishful stupa. If you love short trekking, do that from Kimpun Base Camp or you can now have the cable car ride from Yathae Taung to the top of the mountain, where the stupa is. You can do the day trip from Yangon but we totally recommend to stay overnight there for it’s breathtaking sunset and sunrise views. If you are here in March, that’s the perfect time for it’s Pagoda festival.

entry.title: Chin State
entry.summary: Located on the ridge of 4700ft high in the southern Chin State.
entry.content: Located on the ridge of 4700ft high in the southern Chin State. The town is habited by five different of Chin tribes out of fifty and over. Although most of them believe in Christianity and Buddhism, Animism is also still being practiced, a lot of stone tombs and sacrificial poles can still be seen. The town is famous for its beautiful trekking trails to villages, greeny hill-side plantations and mithun farming. Visiting to face tattooed ladies houses and having the chat with them in person is the best part. Organic fruits are super delicious here. Traditional clothing and smoked mythan meat are the best presents to home from this beautiful city.
